verses.verse: In the Lord<WH3068> put I my trust<WH2620>: how say<WH559> you to my soul<WH5315>, Flee<WH5110> as a bird<WH6833> to your mountain<WH2022>?

For<WH7563>, behold, the wicked bend<WH1869> their bow<WH7198>, they make ready<WH3559> their arrow<WH2671> upon the string<WH3499>, that they may secretly<WH652> shoot<WH3384> at the upright<WH3477> in heart<WH3820>.
If the foundations<WH8356> be destroyed<WH2040>, what can the righteous<WH6662> do<WH6466>?

The Lord<WH3068> is in his holy<WH6944> temple<WH1964>, the Lord<WH3068>'s throne<WH3678> is in heaven<WH8064>: his eyes<WH5869> behold<WH2372>, his eyelids<WH6079> try<WH974>, the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120>.
The Lord<WH3068> tries<WH974> the righteous<WH6662>: but the wicked<WH7563> and him that loves<WH157> violence<WH2555> his soul<WH5315> hates<WH8130>.
Upon the wicked<WH7563> he shall rain<WH4305> snares<WH6341>, fire<WH784> and brimstone<WH1614>, and a horrible<WH2152> storm<WH7307>: this shall be the portion<WH4521> of their cup<WH3563>.
For the righteous<WH6662> Lord<WH3068> loves<WH157> righteousness<WH6666>; his favor<WH6440> does behold<WH2372> the upright<WH3477>.
